intro: Hedyotis americana, commonly known as American inchplant, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It features small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments, thriving in rich, loamy soils. The genus Hedyotis is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes other flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal uses.
